Add jsDelivr hits badge

fix: Next control is not disabled if carousel can rewind

For single-slide carousels, next control should not have disabled class
if rewind is enabled.

Next control logic update

Added logic to add class of 'disabled' to next control when a
non-infinite, non-rewinding carousel contains only one slide.

Added dynamic classes to previous and next controls - when a control takes no action (for example, the previous control at the beginning of a non-infinite carousel or the next control at the end of a non-infinite and non-rewinding carousel), a class of 'disabled' is added to it.
Added styles for disabled and hovered controls.

Make download button on website actually download.

Make download button on website actually download.

Add the `download` attribute to the "Download Here" button so that modern browsers actually download the file instead of just displaying it. Closes #634.

Merge pull request #116 from KingHenne/fix/infinite-index

fix(lory.js): returnIndex() must factor in the value of infinite

fix(lory.js): returnIndex() must factor in the value of infinite

The internal adjustment of the index with the value of infinite is an implementation detail that the
call site should not have to know about. Therefore the value of infinite must be substracted from
the index in returnIndex(). This is in line with slideTo(index) where the given index is adjusted
internally as well, if infinite is set.

BREAKING CHANGE: Any call sites that worked around this bug by manually adjusting the return value
of returnIndex() must remove this work around with this change.

test(lory.test.js): add/refactor tests for .prev()/.next()

Some of the tests regarding returnIndex() are failing because of a bug in lory.js.

chore(package.json): explicitly add peer dependencies

This is required for npm 3.

fix(lory.js): call reset() *before* dispatching resize event

This fixes a problem when trying to read the index
after a resize in an 'on.lory.resize' handler, where the
old index is returned instead of 0, as set in reset().

Ideally lory.js would not register the resize handler at all
and instead let the application register a resize handler
(maybe even debounced) that calls lory.reset().

chore(package.json): add "save-exact" option to npmrc

Add a .npmrc file to specify default options for npm.
By specifying "save-exact" all dependencies installed via npm will
always be saved with their exact version number which prevents future
breakage when other package maintainers make mistakes with their
versioning schema.

feat(package.json): Expose source via jsnext:main field

Expose the source code via "jsnext:main" field in package.json so that
other tools can use the actual source code instead of the bundled code.
More information at: https://github.com/rollup/rollup/wiki/jsnext:main

fix(package.json): Export unminified script in main

Export the unminified version in the package.json's main field to make
it easier to debug when used with a module bundler.
